text:
Bottle 375ml. corked shared at [ A Day To Sink All Sea Shepards tasting. ], Brussels, Belgium. [ As Superstition Framboesa Atando ].[ Bottle #31/416 ]. ABV: 13.5%. Clear dark brown red color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy honey, raspberry, tart raspberry and sweet raspberry. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, honey, raspberry. Body is medium, texture is oily - syrupy - watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160917]
 9-2-9-4-18

Bottle courtesy of kraddel, thanks very much! Clear royal purple color. Floral aroma, berry background. Taste is very fruit forward, starts sweet then lightly tart berries. Complex, every sip is different. Good stuff.

October 15, 2016. Bottle. 
Dark ruby red with no head. Aroma is intense fruity with raspberries, blackberries, dark sugar, a touch of raisins and port wine.
Taste is rich sweet, fruity and tart. Finish is sweet, tart and very light dry with sweet juicy raspberries, blackberries, raisins, some grapes, light dry leather and berry skin notes. Medium to full bodied, oily texture with a slight dry finish. 
Very good.

Bottle bought through hackobock. Pours very dark ruby red leaving some nice looking legs on the glass with a swirl. Smell is intense, fruity and woody with honey, burnt sugar, raspberries, raisins, moist wood, port wine, leather, moist soil and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, sour, fruity, earthy and woody. Mouthfeel is slightly dry, tart, round, slightly boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and sour with honey, raspberries, blackberries, bilberries, black currants, dark grapes, chocolate, vanilla, moist wood, moist soil and alcohol. Very complex with layers upon layers of flavour. Cool stuff and fun to find these levels of complexity in something that isnt diabetus sweet!
A: Light hazy purple coloured with a small brown note. N: Raspberry, cassis, billberry, honey T: Raspberry, blueberry, cassis, blackberry O: Nice balanced sweetness, tart and fruit. Nice!

Bottle at Linus tasting 161015. Dark purple color. Berry aroma, raspberries, cherries, vinous notes. Sweet cherry flavor, red berries, caramel, some raspberries, red currant. Really good but a bit sugary. Dry finish.

Bottle shared at A Day To Sink All Sea Shepards tasting. Hazy dark red purple with no head. Aroma of deep red fruits, big raspberries and a floral honey character behind. Flavour is heavy sweet. Medium bodied with flat carbonation.

Bottle shared at the original Chez Moeder Lambics cellar. Thanks Kraddel! Dark brown reddish color with no head. Fruity aroma, raspberries, honey, light vinous. Sweet, light bitter and light acidic taste. Medium oily silky body with flat carbonation.

Big, epic thnx to Jason for making it possible for me to try this ! Pours very dark brown. of course, no head. Smell is huge, sweet, but has a funky aspect, I guess by the raspberry sourness. Taste is very full, sweet, candy-sweetness ( caramelized fruit ) bit sour-ish ( almost) trough the fruityness that is very intense. thick, rich, caramel-coated raspberry
Big honey aroma, also great port character. If I hadnt had Endo right before this, it would have probably gotten a perfect score too

Bottle at Superstition, pours a deep dark mahogany. Aroma brings out decadent raspberries, dry port barrel presence and light candied sugar. Flavour is sweet and treacly, with loads of raspberries upfront, followed by treacle, candied / brown sugar, and light port. Decadent as hell. If I had to choose a favourite between this and the Endo, itd be that, but by a narrow margin. Phenomenal stuff.

Pours a deep purple red. Very bright and clear. Aromas of raspberry jam, light hints of wine tannins. Slight alcohol. Taste is sweet obviously. Doesnt have the sour finish that endovicus has. Just very jammy and complex. Amazing.

Taster pour at the meadery. Dark red pour, maybe a tinge brown? Kind of dark here at the bar. Massive raspberry nose. Super sticky fruit with some caramel and toffee notes from the candi sugar. Wonderful.
Bottle share at RBB. Pour is violet/magenta with no head. Flavor and aroma of sweet raspberry juice, dark honey, brown sugar, oak, and some wine tannins.

RBWG16. Bottle pours with a deep amber red body that leaves behind a modest degree of legginess. The aroma offers up some honey with a bit of wax and then it unloads seductive levels of reduced sticky raspberry goodness. Goodness. Oh yeah. The taste explodes with soft flavor rich tooth enamel staining berry yum. The berry notes are just rich and deep and then pick up a modest level of berry tartness that is balanced out nicely with the rich sweet soft honey notes. This stuff just goes and goes and I just love the nectar rich berry, wow. I could just drink this all night, no problem.
A wonderful barrel aged mead from Superstition. None of the syrupy mouthfeel present in so many meads. I though it would be hard to top the white series, but this does just that. Amazing!

Bottle @ RBWG 2016. Thanks, Dak. Blood red colored pour. Really, really woody. A lot of fruit stems and skins. Pretty heavy berry character and a bit of pinot noir. Slight acidity and even a touch savory. Raspberry certainly dominates this one. Isnt super sweet and has some nice balance to it. Maybe a touch of citrus, too.

Bottle shared by daknole at the RB Best Awards - thanks again, Dak! Pours a deep, kind of hazy blood red mahogany with no head. Notes of raspberry, red grapes, blackberries, black cherries, honey, oak, and toasted sugar. Full-bodied, with low carbonation and a coating, sweet, vinous, jammy mouthfeel. Rich. Really crazy stuff. Great.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Reddish brown. Lots of jammy berries, honey. Sweet. Rounded.
Bottle at the Rate Beer Awards Festival Bottle Share. Cheers, Dak. Blood red, flat. Great raspberry and honey nose, oranges. Huge raspberry flavor, luscious honey. Simply lovely.

Bottle at RBWG. Thanks Dak! This one pours a blood red color. The aroma is super sweet and potent with cherry and raspberry. The flavor is massively sweet with authentic raspberry jam. Very thick and immensely juicy. A little wood near the finish. Jammy. Crazy stuff.

Bottle at the RB Awards, thanks to daknole for sharing 
Clear dark mahogany, no head or lacing. Aroma of berries and honey. Flavors of berries, honey and sugar 
Very good, smooth

375 ml bottle to taster (BIG thanks to daknole). Looks good; a still and deep purplish brown. Smells of a nice balance of raspberries and candied sugar with some honey in the background. Tastes like it smells, but more robust, with a bit of black cherry as well. Mouthfeel is full-bodied, tart, and smooth for the abv. Wonderful!

Bottle at RBWG 2016. Big thanks to Dak. Nose is an earthy honey with light juniper and jasmine. Some light fusel alcohols. Definitely high boost. A light licorice. Deep red to almost brown. Taste is simply great. A light honey note throughout a mixed fruit bowl flavor. Finished with a touch of pepper and hints of dried fruits. Pretty dang good. Nice that it isnt too cloying.

Bottl @ RBWG. Thanks dak. Pours a deep red violet appearance with no head. Chocolate, raspberries, vanilla, cocoa, and coconut. Delicious raspberry mead with medium acidity and not overpowering sweetness. Quite a bit of tannins and acid. Pretty delicious
Bottle - Nice balance between raspberry and honey. Deep purple red. Raspberry, delicate honey, a transition of flavours that is seamless and a long fruity finish. Well done.

Small bottle thanks to dak. Pours out a maroon color. Nose is out of this world raspberry jam rich honey sweetness some spice almost the nose is amazing. Taste is more of raspberry jam sweetness rich honey notes wow this is nuts. I am not a fan of America mead mostly but this is crazy good.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy ruby with no head. The aroma is strong raspberry, oak, port. Thick mouth, so jammy, berry, oak, vinous, amazing stuff.
Such a complex and delicious combination of the raspberry jaminess and fruit notes, the belgian dark candi syrup and barrel treatment really work well in this one
UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 A bit sweeter than endovelicus.  The port character shows its head more here. An excellent drink, can't wait to try it again.
the best balanced mead superstition has made. a balance between the sweet and the tart. dark and smooth. smells like heaven. perfection. great work jeff and carlos.
Amazing. Deep purple, hints of a port brown color. This is an amazingly well balanced mead. Raspberry, tannins, oak, port, finishes with just a hint of dryness.
Smell is incredibly deep raspberry. Taste is insanely rich, sweet, tart, jammy raspberry. Absolutely delicious and sets the bar pretty high for raspberry meads. Full body and sticks to the mouth.

Taster at the meadery. A sharp and very sweet nose of pungent tawny port, extremely earthy raspberry, funky damp oak, a healthy amount of alcohol, and a strange vegetal note similar to rhubarb with a minor herbal blend at the end. Clear deep copper pour. The taste is incredibly smooth and complex with layers of raspberry, slightly boozy port (which provides an immediate dryness), solid honey (but not too sweet), moderate boozy heat, and a brief mesquite flourish to close. The port creates a bone-dry finish to the point where its nearly gritty. A very well-crafted mead; the amazing balance between the flavors is what sets this one apart from Superstitions other top-notch offerings, but I think it might need a wee bit more time to reach its full potential.

Appearance is almost tawny in color. Aroma of mesquite right off the bat followed by fresh raspberries. Flavor of sweet raspberry up front followed by oak and finishes with a wonderful port flavor. Finishes semi sweet with a slight dryness that makes you want to take another sip. An amazing complex mead, very thankful to get to try this.
